message.content:
cs.RO, cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.SD, cs.NE 

This paper describes a new human-in-the-loop assistive grasping system, which involves the use of robotics and human-computer interaction. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.RO (Robotics). The paper also focuses on the feasibility of using different input devices for the assistive grasping system, which involves human-computer interaction and human factors. Therefore, cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) is also a likely category. The paper also involves the development of a novel sEMG device, which could fall under cs.CY (Computational Biology and Bioinformatics) or cs.SD (Sound). Finally, the paper discusses the potential of sEMG-based control for severely disabled individuals, which could fall under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
